attributes.action:
Stop 5G Mast on Albany Rd 
A Conservation Area Overlooking World Heritage Views
attributes.additional_details:
Albany Rd is of special architectural interest, changes should be to preserve and enhance. 
Albany Rd is one of two roads in Redruth's conservation area
Council Policy - All efforts must be demonstrated to have been made to find a location out of a conservation area.
Local Council: No consultation with local community about mast or finding a more suitable location.
Obstructed views across to landmark buildings and protected world heritage countryside
The tree lined rd is teaming with wildlife
attributes.background:
Sect 72 (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990: A need to protect the character of Victorian tree lined streets
Local Council: Transparency with residents is needed
To protect conservation areas, world heritage views and rural scenery using MP J Lopez's 'Tighter rules on visual impact'

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign:

'Exclude telecommunication installations from permitted development legislation': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/635960
